channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - World

item.dc:creator: Elena Becatoros and Jon Gambrell
item.description: Ukrainian fighters holed up in a steel plant in Mariupol made their last stand to prevent Moscow’s takeover of the strategic port.
item.title: UN rescues civilians from Mariupol plant as Ukrainian fighters try to prevent takeover

item.dc:creator: Andrea Rodriguez
item.description: At least eight people are dead and dozens injured after an explosion at the 96-room Hotel Saratoga in Havana.
item.title: Deadly explosion at hotel in Cuban capital

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: The Queen has ruled that only family members who are undertaking official duties on her behalf will be on the balcony for Trooping the Colour.
item.title: Harry, Meghan, Andrew won’t appear on balcony during Queen’s jubilee

item.description: Amber Heard has returned to the stand for a second day detailing how a 'perceived' affair with a fellow actor led to Johnny Depp allegedly assaulting her on his private jet.
item.title: Amber Heard returns to stand for second day

item.description: Russia has intensified its assault on the Azovstal steelworks, bombing from the air and pushing forward on the ground.
item.title: Russia intensifies assault on Ukrainian steelworks

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady and Angus Thompson
item.description: At the time, Facebook said it had made “mistakes” in the blocking of thousands of pages from its platform but internally its most senior leaders were delighted with the project.
item.title: ‘Putting lives at risk’: Sims takes aim at Facebook over new whistleblower allegations

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: In Partygate’s wake, Conservatives have faced heavy losses, but look to have avoided the landslide defeat predicted by some pollsters.
item.title: Flagship Tory councils bruised as Boris Johnson backlash bites

item.dc:creator: Anton Troianovski
item.description: The sufferings of the besieged port have horrified the world, but in Russia, it is portrayed as a triumph.
item.title: Why the battle for Mariupol is so important for Putin

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: Ferdinand Bongbong Marcos splashes cash at eight-hour rallies to distract voters from his family’s notorious legacy.
item.title: Party politics, Philippines style: dictator’s son Bongbong on song for presidency

item.description: A rock-star reception for a Philippine political candidate with a familiar surname.
item.title: “Bongbong” Marcos' campaign rally

item.description: The week in photos from the award-winning SMH and AFR photographers.
item.title: The Sydney Morning Herald, Photos of the Week, May 5, 2022

item.dc:creator: Lisa Richwine and Matthew Barakat
item.description: Amber Heard said Johnny Depp threatened her life when she visited him on the Gold Coast shortly after they were married while he was filming Pirates of the Caribbean 5.
item.title: Heard tells court Depp sexually assaulted her during Australia trip

item.description: A helicopter captured dozens of sharks basking in shallow waters off Tampa this week.
item.title: Authorities issue warning after 'dozens' of sharks spotted

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Joseph Krauss
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett said he accepted an apology from Russian President in a call. The Russian statement made no mention of an apology.
item.title: Vladimir Putin apologises over Lavrov’s ‘Hitler was Jewish’ remarks, says Israel’s leader

item.description: Scores of Ukrainian civilians remain trapped at the steelworks in the besieged city of Mariupol.
item.title: Gallery: Ukraine - Russia crisis, May 6th, 2022

item.dc:creator: Brenda Goh
item.description: Even when entire buildings are sealed off and locked down, people are still testing positive, exposing just how infectious the Omicron variant can be.
item.title: ‘I have no idea how we caught it’: Shanghai residents fear they’ll never reach COVID zero

item.dc:creator: Zeke Miller
item.description: Taking the lectern briefly while Psaki briefed the press, Jean-Pierre said she was “still processing” the significance of her hire, calling it “an honour and privilege to be behind this podium”.
item.title: Goodbye Jen, Hello Karine: Biden taps first black LGBTQ woman White House press secretary

item.dc:creator: Patricia Zengerle
item.description: The daughter of US president John Kennedy heads to Canberra as its relationship with Washington strengthens in response to China’s growing power.
item.title: Caroline Kennedy confirmed as US ambassador to Australia

item.description: Russia continues to focus its attacks on the south-east of Ukraine with the help of militias based in separatist-held territory.
item.title: Gallery: Ukraine-Russia crisis, May 5, 2022
